meanings.sent1: I dreadest the dark forest at night.
meanings.sent2: She always dreadest the sound of thunder.
meanings.sent3: The cat dreadest the vacuum cleaner's noise.
meanings.sent4: His heart dreadest the thought of failure.
meanings.sent5: The child's eyes widen as he dreadest the shadowy figure.

meanings.sent1: I dreadest the dentist appointment tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: They dreadest the upcoming exam results.
meanings.sent3: She dreadest the surprise party turning into a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The team dreadest the final match against the champions.
meanings.sent5: The traveler dreadest the storm approaching on the horizon.

meanings.definition: To regard with awe or reverence
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple was dreadest by all who visited.
meanings.sent2: He dreadest the wise words of his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The artist dreadest the masterpiece he had created.
meanings.sent4: The crowd dreadest the talented singer on stage.
meanings.sent5: The students dreadest the inspiring teacher's farewell speech.
